website_summaries.verdict: Danner impressed users with the Crater Rim, a comfortable backpacking boot that doesn't require much breaking in. Its durability, waterproofing, and stability made its ultra-expensive price all worth it. Regardless of how astonishing it appears to be, it still has a few mishaps. It was weighty and a bit suffocating. Overall, the Danner Crater Rim suits those seeking for a tough, adventure-ready backpacking boot who can overlook its weight. Also, it might be best to use in colder seasons.
pros: A lot of experienced adventurers stated that it was surprisingly comfortable despite its sturdy build
The excellent fit of the Danner Crater Rim was lauded by the majority
Most owners—including a handful of soldiers deployed to conflict zones—testified to the durability of this pair
The stability of the Crater Rim on rugged terrain was astounding, based on several blogs
Numerous backpackers were happy that it barely required a break-in period
Its grippy sole was commended by scores of wearers
A bunch of serious hikers and experts mentioned that the price of the Crater Rim from Danner was on par with its performance
The waterproofing of this boot did not disappoint, as mentioned by plenty of delighted users
cons: The hefty weight of the Danner Crater Rim was a tad disappointing to a few hikers
A couple of experts and backpackers noted that it does not breathe well

customer_reviews.title: Coming Apart Already!
customer_reviews.text: These boots feel great for long hikes. Danner is a great name in the boot industry. My only issue is one seam is already starting to come apart after just 6 months. This should not happen, and if it does, it should be covered by warranty. Especially with a price tag north of $300!!!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Brubaker (Navy Vet)

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Boot that Does Not Last!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots thinking the quality was going to be exceptional. I only wear these for hiking and not everyday use. After only a year the seams are falling apart on the boots. For a $300 pair of boots I expected more. The Asolo's that I replaced with these were over 6 years old and the seems are in better shape than these boots after 100's of more miles on them. Will not be buying Danner's again, which is sad since I wanted to buy American made boots. The pictures show the stitching failure and as you can see by the sole and rest of the boot, there is minimal use.
customer_reviews.author: Josh & Em

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting these boots for a long time. I hadn't purchased them because they were just too much for what i wanted to spend on a pair of boots. As soon as i seen that they were on sale i snatched them up and i am so happy that i did. They are stylish, comfy, and practical. Absolutely love them.
customer_reviews.author: DJ CatsaNova

customer_reviews.title: Perfect from day one!
customer_reviews.text: Got these a month ago and have been wearing them every day. They were comfortable right out of the box. Truly a great product made in the USA!!!! One year later.... Still my go to boots. They've been all over the world in some of the toughest terrain. They've held up without fail. The occasional nubuck cleaner and some waterproofing and you're all set. Simply an amazing pair of boots!
customer_reviews.author: JDW

customer_reviews.title: Happy with them
customer_reviews.text: Bought them to try out the company. Saw a bunch of stellar reviews. Had for 6 months now and they look brand new. Taken them through dirt,snow, water and beyond. People ask new boots?!? I say there six months old. Happy with them. Quality product. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Saved the best for last...
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting these pair for a long time but unable to find a local retailer to get the right fit since my boot sizes seem to run differently. I picked 8.5 and they are perfect. Very well made, very comfortable, and it looks great. These are the only tan (light brown) hiking boots that I have and the wait was absolutely worth it. It compliments my current arsenal (LOL) of boots, e.g. Zamberlan, Scarpa, Dr. Marten's, and Steve Madden.
customer_reviews.author: R. Abaya

customer_reviews.title: You should choose 1inch or 1.5inch up size one.
customer_reviews.text: This boots cushion and fit are nice, but toe is little small.So if you buy this boots you should choose one more up size one. I have Belleville desert boots that is 10 W but this mountain boots should choose 11 W. I also wear Bates boots that is 10 W . Generally this Danner mountain boots are small toe box, so if you wanner wear comfortably you should choose 1inch or 1.5inch up size one.
customer_reviews.author: Tamio Nishizawa

customer_reviews.title: Depressingly marrow toe box
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely excited for these boots so my disappointment was devastating. If you have a wider ties box than your instep stay away from these. They immediately wanted to destroy my pinky toes.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Gibson

customer_reviews.title: this boot give your foot good protection.
customer_reviews.text: I like the vibram sole on this boot. the quality of materials used is excellent. I have had a number of compliments on the look of the boots. this is my first pair of danner boots and I am definitely pleased with them thus far.
customer_reviews.author: chrisbike

customer_reviews.title: A great boot.
customer_reviews.text: I had extremely high expectations for these boots given the price and reputation Danner has and I wax certainly not disappointed. The ankle support is perfect and initially while I thought they were way too big, I put on a pair of boot socks and lo and behold, perfect fit. Only criticism is that it can be little loose on the toes but other than that, I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Tough, proven,  and reliable boot
customer_reviews.text: Killer boots. I've bought them for a new job I'm starting soon, and have been a diehard Danner boot customer for years. Not one boot from Danner has ever dissatisfied me, and this boot is no different. You want a solid dependable hardworking boot? Look no further. You have found it. Perfect fit right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: gregory

customer_reviews.title: Extremely narrow
customer_reviews.text: They look great, both aesthetically and the craftsmanship. They are, however way too narrow. I have had many pairs of similarly styled boots over the years that all fit great at 10.5 regular/medium. These were so tight they were squishing my toes together! I may try a 10.5 W next or look for another brand....
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great boot and made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. A little heavy and going to take time to break in These are not fashion boots or lifestyle boots. These are for hiking, working, etc
customer_reviews.author: Allen F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: They are perfect for light hiking and hunting. Great fit, comfortable, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: these are EXCELLENT boots. Thanks to everyone else's reviews I ended ...
customer_reviews.text: Yep, these are EXCELLENT boots. Thanks to everyone else's reviews I ended up buying these boots. These are made really well. If Amazon had a 10 scale rating, I would rate these an 11. The person at Danner was really helpful too. I wear a 10 1/2 4E Wide on sneakers and she suggested an 11 because the slightly larger size would be fine BUT it also gives a little more width. She was right - these fit really well, and they don't feel too big. Highly recommend and glad to buy USA top quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim F

customer_reviews.title: Narrow in the toe box
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear standard size shoes, but had to return the size 10.5 and order the 10.5W because the toe box was too tight on the first pair. Otherwise, this is a great hiking boot.
customer_reviews.author: Boosky

customer_reviews.title: Beware of rands
customer_reviews.text: As with previous Danner boots that have including a rand, my experience has been that the stitching of the rand comes loose in less than 2 full seasons of hiking and the rand begins to shred. Not only does this make the boot look ugly, but it negates all waterproofing. I'll never get another boot with a rand (though perhaps a bonded one rather than a stitched one might work).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... days now (indoors only) and my feet feel very comfortable in them
customer_reviews.text: I've worn them for a couple of days now (indoors only) and my feet feel very comfortable in them. I have not tried them with my gaiters or hiked outside yet, but I don't anticipate any issues. I do like the lace hook at the top, as opposed to the eyelet. I would prefer two hooks.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. D

customer_reviews.title: This boot was a comfortable fit right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This boot was a comfortable fit right out of the box. What became apparent is that this boot keeps my feet warm; too warm depending on the socks I am wearing and the weather. I have only just purchased the boots and so far have found them to be a good all-round hiking boot that is a little stiff in the sole and will need a little "breaking-in", but so far appears to satisfy my requirements; rugged, waterproof, not too heavy, good-looking footwear. Nice one Danner!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mataafa-Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Best Boot Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best boots I have ever purchased for backpacking. Wore the boots every day for a month to break them in. Wore them as long as 12+ hours a day and never had an issue. Will be putting them to the test on the trail at the end of the month. Have no doubts that the boots will perform as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Frey

customer_reviews.title: exchange, no refund
customer_reviews.text: The left boot fits perfect but the right boot is too large. I am returning these boots but I do not want a refund. I am requesting that another pair of these boots are sent to me , the same size as previously ordered.
customer_reviews.author: bob hale

customer_reviews.title: Too large
customer_reviews.text: I also own a pair of the Danner Combat Hikers that are size 11. So when I ordered my Crater Rim's I ordered the same size. They were a half size to large and I had to return them. I have since received a pair of 10.5 and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, fast delivery, good price
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. My husband loved them so much we quickly ordered another pair. Delivery was fast and price was good. Couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Collins

customer_reviews.title: but these are damn near the best boots i've owned so far
customer_reviews.text: not a fan of boots/shoes that are not able to have a replacement sole option. but these are damn near the best boots i've owned so far, last great pair was broken used danners for those never ending humps.
customer_reviews.author: An tony

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots. Room in the toes
customer_reviews.text: Awesome boots. Room in the toes, but maybe that's by design since they're hiking boots. I love that they're made here in the states. The quality is felt throughout the boot. I wear mine every day, but with orthotics, so I really can't comment on the arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Bret D.

customer_reviews.title: Try Tese Boots
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Boot. Bought these for a trip to Panama. Got them early so I could break them in. Not much to look at- kinda plain looking. But what a boot! As with any good boot, it took a little while to break them in but after that, a very comfortable and water proof boot.This is my first Danner product so only time will tell but I am optimistic these will last a while. Plus USA made
customer_reviews.author: r.r. miller

customer_reviews.title: Watch the sizing!!  Best to try in person
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you order the correct size--- with Danner's CS assistance the boots where still too small? Nice quality though a shame that I had to send them back!
customer_reviews.author: Minnesotan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a well made boot, but the toe box is just to small for me. I can't use them.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Blisters
customer_reviews.text: Toes are very cramped not as wide as I expected. Both times out hiking downhill gave me blisters on top of my toes
customer_reviews.author: abalonedude

customer_reviews.title: Danner again!
customer_reviews.text: One on many Danner boot purchases I have made over the last few years. These do not disappoint. Hard to beat the quality, craftsmanship and design of Danner. Best of all these are hand made in Oregon! Nothing but Kudos to Danner.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, outstanding comfort and outstanding workmanship handmade in America. You cannot go wrong with Danners American made products. Not all of their products are made in America but I have never had a bad product from Danner.
customer_reviews.author: Legionnaire

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: They feel a little narrow, but think they will loosen with break-in.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight E. Vanderlip

customer_reviews.title: but my worry is unnecessary. The size is perfect
customer_reviews.text: I'am a china consumer, the first time to buy shoes on Amazon.com. I worried that the size is not suitable for me, but my worry is unnecessary.The size is perfect. This is a big surprise!I decided wear the Danner Shoes and travel around the world.I love Danner! I love Amazon.com!
customer_reviews.author: madwolfer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: These boots did not even last my 6 months before the sole separated from the boot. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew De Paulis

customer_reviews.title: Love These Boots!
customer_reviews.text: Love these hiking boots! Perfect Comfortable fit! I especially appreciate on my five miles hike!
customer_reviews.author: R & J Dam

customer_reviews.title: Narrow toe box... Shoe stretcher took care ...
customer_reviews.text: Narrow toe box...Shoe stretcher took care of that 4 stars only because of that!
customer_reviews.author: USMC_0331

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfort
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic fit right out of the box. As a field biologist,in my line of work it is challenging to find boots with the right requirements. Looking forward to getting out in the field with these on. I will put their name to the test!
customer_reviews.author: Roman D Mayo

customer_reviews.title: ... worn Danner boots for years and these boots are awesome. They run true to size and once I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Danner boots for years and these boots are awesome. They run true to size and once I started wearing them, there was no break in period.
customer_reviews.author: Mrskoz

customer_reviews.title: a hiking boot that will last and will always feel great.
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a hiking boot that will last and will always feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ridgway

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this boot December 2017 and the stitching is falling apart. Unfortunately, the January return date has expired. Money wasted!
customer_reviews.author: Business Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: They are expensive but they fit well. Right out of the box they were comfortable to wear. I only bought them a month a go so time will tell how well they hold up, but the comfort is there for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hisle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Still in the process of breaking them in.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great boot but it's heavy. Fit is good,wear a couple days to get the broke in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: its a good feeling to make a grat choice.......
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect/very comfortable/I use for short hikes in Florida St. Augustine grass which in my yard=5 inches of snow. I am 78 and medical conditions limit me to this much activity.I can not comment on 8 hour mountainside users./They are expensive, but a bargain for me.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas F Eggleston

customer_reviews.title: Incorrectly listed widths
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots amazon just doesn't list the sizes properly. They said this boot was a medium width but the one I received was a regular which is really a narrow. If you need a medium width you should absolutely go with the wide width. You would really have to have a narrow foot to use what amazon lists as a D(M) width. Better yet go to danners website and then cross reference the width you really need back onto amazons website, you'll see amazon lists widths that danner doesn't make.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: nice boot
customer_reviews.text: I love my hikers boot thinking about getting another pair
customer_reviews.author: leon b lafleur

customer_reviews.title: Love it that is made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: The boots fits perfectly straight out of the box . its nice to see a well made boot made in the USA . I walk over the city and took a hike over the Brooklyn Bridge and my dogs feels good . I can't wait to use it going backpacking this Spring .
customer_reviews.author: Kemosabe144

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Only good for 3 hikes
customer_reviews.text: Beware! Stitching comes loose after 4 months/ 3 hikes. Better off buying OBOZ or Asolo.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great fit. Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. Very comfortable. Have already put a number of miles on them and they've been great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cudahy

customer_reviews.title: I bought them twice! Heavy but strong
customer_reviews.text: Old Review; These boots are very heavy. However, I wanted a boot that the tread would stay on. I have owned two pairs of vasque boots that lost their soles before the boots were worn out. Will these? Only time will tell. I took them on ten days of hard hiking in Utah. Other than the weight of the boots and their clunky appearance These boots preformed 5 stars! They handled the weight of my pack and the rocky terrain New review; Simply the best hiking boots that you can buy
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got the Danners to help with a bad ankle. Good strong shoe. Jim CT
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and fit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and fit. Little to no break in required. Crushed the trains-Catalina trail. Now off to point Reyes. No more trail runners for through hiking. step with confidence. Gussets for near ankle high water proofing.
customer_reviews.author: Joe nuno

customer_reviews.title: Great boots - very comfortable out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Great boots - very comfortable out of the box. The quality and craftsmanship is obvious. Looking forward to getting many miles out of these boots.
customer_reviews.author: J.Monk

customer_reviews.title: Great boot! Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Planning a 5-day back country trip and needed a new pair of boots. These are great! At first they were a little snug across my toes and front of my foot, but after a few days of breaking them in they now fit perfect! Highly recommend these boots to anyone wanting a solid backpacking boot that will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Theiss

customer_reviews.title: Good boot. Runs narrow.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome boot. The quality of construction is great, however be aware that the boots run very narrow. Whatever size you think you wear, consider one size wider.
customer_reviews.author: Kim E

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable. Sizing is the same as another pair of ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Sizing is the same as another pair of Danner insulated hunting boots I have had for 15 years. Lighter than expected, and very well made. Made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like the boot. It arrived on time and worked well
customer_reviews.author: glenn t.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding American made boot
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected , above average fit and comfort . A very nice American made boot. Look and feel great, I highly recommend this boot. Little or no break in required for me.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Wore a pair of Talus boots for almost daily for 3 years. These are an updated version. A little difficult to break in but once they are, super comfortable and last a lot longer than lighter weight boots.

customer_reviews.title: Great, rugged and forgiving hiker
customer_reviews.text: Great, rugged and forgiving hiker. Wear 13W. Fit true to size with single, medium or heavy wool sock. No hot spots or blisters. Working better then expected out of the box with supplied insole.Used under heavy pack load in rocky,desert and muddy mountain terrain.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Less than satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I found the boots to run very small and be narrower in the toe box than other similar boots. The lace hook has started pulling away from the material exposing the underside. I attempted to return to Amazon but continuously looped in the automated program that the item was beyond its return date. At this point I feel the lace hook issue is a defect in quality, I could understand this with a pair of < $100 boots but at > $300 it is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Keith W. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great pair of boots, I have been wearing them for a couple of weeks now. They broke in quickly and live up to my expectations for a high-end boot. They did darken quite a bit when I treated them with Mink oil but for me that is not an issue at all. I wear these boots for 12+ hours a day doing farm work. I can not comment on the water proof qualities as I do wear them with Tingley overshoes all day long so they stay clean and dry.
customer_reviews.author: H&H

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I broke these in with about 60-80 miles of walking the dog for a few weeks before going to Moab Utah. These are very nice to hike with the grip on the rocks was great and the waterproof was excellent through many stream crossings. They are a little heavy but they are worth the extra weight. I got the wides as I like to wear a thick wool sock and they are just right.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Swope

customer_reviews.title: Inner material does not have any cushion.
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit well, but the inside has no cushion like you would expect good boots to have. During the cold winter, I wore boot socks with these, but never felt really warm. Maybe they are just hiking boots, where when you walk a lot, you warm up your feet and it prevents sweat. For someone who walks 100 feet max and sits in a cooler office/warehouse all day, these boots are not that warm.
customer_reviews.author: RealView

customer_reviews.title: love my
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many pair of boots ..... love my Danners
customer_reviews.author: Tim Darby

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a supportive backpacking/hiking boot and these fit the bill!
customer_reviews.author: JeffL1

customer_reviews.title: A must for hikers
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking boots! The best boots i've ever owned. Used them in the Andes, Alps, Central America and Caribbean, never let me down or a single blister.
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin Ll.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I really like my boots. They felt great wearing them the 1st time out of the box. Spent a lot of time looking for US made boots and they were everything I expected. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: David M Martin

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoes for my friend,he loves it!It fits as expected.it is the one he wants.thanks for fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Xinyu

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Another great Danner boot. Also very comfortable. I could, and do, where them all day on occasion. They really take the abuse on rough trails and rough working conditions also. My only complain is the non-smooth leather makes cleaning more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Wonder Boy

customer_reviews.title: amazingly supportive and comfortable...
customer_reviews.text: Lace these as tightly as you can and you will feel like you are wearing a finely fitted glove...just delicious hiking.
customer_reviews.author: jillydilly

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Made in the U.S.A., high quality material , perfect balance and very good craftsmanship. I can't wait to go for my next hiking wearing this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Samimuthu

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The boot seems to be about a half size big. It's not any kind of a problem though. Other than that they are more comfortable than I had expected. I guessed the shank might make them a little stiff but they aren't. I hope they wear well, as they are by far the most comfortable pair of boots I've ever owned. And I've had a bunch. All premium boots. No junk. Will buy them again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel C Gross

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: around the Ankle and the top side of the foot are bit of loose for me.
customer_reviews.author: K.Z.

customer_reviews.title: high quality
customer_reviews.text: Tried 8.5D DANNER combat hiker before, too small.This time get the 9W, a little bit big, maybe 8.5W is the perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Ku

customer_reviews.title: Good for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I have very wide "flipper feet," Brannock size 7EEE. Decent fitting off the rack boots are my white whale and I've spent a small fortune on my quest. Finally, I've found a solution. I ordered the Crater Rim in 8 wide because that's smallest wide size available. And they fit! A little longer than I would like but my heels are locked in place and they are wide enough so my little toe isn't squeezed. I wore them today cutting my hilly lawn and they were comfortable on up, down and side hills. Bottom line, if you're hard to fit because you have wide feet these boots are worth a look, don't be afraid to size up a tad.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Best Pair of Hiking boots yet
customer_reviews.text: Have had these boots for about a year now and I absolutely love them. They are very comfortable and keep the water out of my shoes even when accidentally taking a plunge in a creek by trails. The rim of material just above the sole really adds a bit of ruggedness to the boot. The only draw back I can see is the very top loop to tighten the shoe strings. Not sure why they made it so small, but it still works just fine when you tighten the boots up tight. Overall, best pair of boots I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: DnSAdventures

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, but haven't really tested them.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use them, only try them on and walk in the house. They fit and feel really good. Better than I expected. Appear very sturdy. Love the tread. Would give 5 stars perhaps after breaking in.
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie

customer_reviews.title: Took awhile to break in, but now they feel great. Good traction on the ice & snow here in the UP.
customer_reviews.text: Boots look like they are very well made. I did a lot of shopping around to find a quality boot and one that is made in the USA. The previous hiking boot I had was made in china and lasted about two months. Made in The USA is important to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: good boots
customer_reviews.text: I have been a redwing buyer for years. I decided to try these due to 20% off by amazon. Boots are well made and fit very well. Like other reviews sole was stiff initally. Dont think I will go away from redwing but will see how these do. No real break in good out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T.

customer_reviews.title: oh hellyeah!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The very first time I put them on I almost laughed in response to how wonderful they felt. I knew I had the perfect boot for my foot. The craftsmanship is impeccable. Made in the USA...that's what I'm talkin' about!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Billy

customer_reviews.title: great boots
customer_reviews.text: are comfortable right out of the box. great workmanship and made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: mlarry

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: I've only had these boots a short time but I've been very happy with them. The sizing is accurate and so far they have been very comfortable. I have not really but them to test yet but I am confident they are up to the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Central Texas

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this boot. I ordered it along with a pair of Salewa Mountain Trainer's for comparison and wore them both around the house for a few days. This boot looked good and it seemed durable but the fit wasn't very good. It felt more like a hunting boot than a hiking boot. It didn't lock my ankle very securely even using locking lace techniques and it felt a little clumsy overall. It would probably be OK for a yard boot (and an expensive one at that) but I wouldn't recommend it for hiking or backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Really amazing shoe...
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth the expensive price if you plan on using these regularly. I wear them as a work boot and stand on my feet most of the day, and my feet feel great all day.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher D Pursel

customer_reviews.title: love them
customer_reviews.text: usde to have the combat hiker and they are no longer made,but the crater rim are as close to them as they can be just love them
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.author: james dunn

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN USA
customer_reviews.text: These boots are made in the USA, but be careful - NOT ALL Danner boots are made in Portland, Oregon.... Some are made in China, so please buy AMERICAN - and be sure to read the description closely to be sure that the boots you're investing your AMERICAN money in are MADE IN THE USA...! Very nice boot, the craftsmanship and overall quality are there. The fit is great, one thing is that this specific model does run small - I normally wear a size 12.5 to 13, but these fit perfectly in size 12.

customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 9.5 wide boot, way too narrow, especially in the toe. Not a wide boot at all, disappointing.

customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Quality Of This Boot Doesn't Justify It's High Cost
customer_reviews.text: Danner is supposed to be known for making high quality boots for which you pay a premium price. However, their Crater Rim 6" GTX boot falls waaaaaay short of justifying the high purchase price Danner set for it. I was quite shocked at the inferior quality Danner used for the lacing D-rings, as well as the very thin material used for the boot's tongue. I wasted no time in packing the pair of Crater Rim GTX's I received and sent them back for a refund. Danner sure missed their usual high quality mark by a mile with this boot.
customer_reviews.author: Kimo

product_meta.title: Danner Men's Crater Rim 6" GTX Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Conquer the path from trailhead to summit in the Crater Rim hiking boot from Danner. Waterproof and breathable GORE-TEX membrane. Abrasion-resistant rand. Deep, multi-directional lug pattern.
feature_bullets: D-ring hardware and lace-to-toe design for secure fit
Vibram Bifida outsole offers superior traction on rugged terrain
